team_members.descriptionEn:
Allie (she/they; ella/elle), is a Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW) in the state of New Mexico. Prior to her work in New Mexico, Allie was a social worker and case manager in Texas and Louisiana in where she was able to work with vulnerable populations in the deep south. She graduated with an undergraduate degree in Women and Gender Studies from Tulane University in 2013 and her Masters in Social Work from USC in 2020.  

The foundation of Allie�s clinical practice is seeing past the binary imposed by social systems and supporting people in living their best life. Through her studies, work and personal life, she has learned that navigating the world as our genuine and most authentic self with all of our intersecting identities, is a beautiful and healing experience. As a social worker, Allie views mental health work as an integral part of social justice. This perspective acknowledges there are systemic factors that contribute to mental health disparities and positions therapy as a means of challenging and transforming those systems. Allie�s practice is rooted in supporting LGBTQIA+, HIV/Aids, BIPOC communities and promoting bodily autonomy for all.

Incorporating her personal experience as a Latine individual adds a layer of cultural competence and understanding to her practice. Her dedication to social justice, inclusivity, and helping others empower themselves reflects her compassionate and transformative approach to mental health care. Allie utilizes CBT, DBT, Somatic and a �real� talk approach. She deeply believes in self determination and paving a way forward in where the client is in the driver seat of their own mental health journey.

She finds joy and rejuvenation in her queer little family with her 4 dogs, bearded dragon, 4 sisters and her husband, Dany. She is 3rd generation Chicana and Navajo; coming from the eldest daughter, grandchild and sibling experience. She enjoys art, makeup, true crime and just going for a drive while listening to music.

 

Currently, Allie�s caseload is full and there is a wait list.

Hello! I am Amy Melendrez, a licensed social worker in New Mexico and native Spanish speaker. I am a first generation college graduate and obtained my Master and Bachelors in social worker from New Mexico Highlands University. I have worked serving the Latinx and immigrant community and have experience working with adolescents, adults and families. I believe everyone has a right to education, healing and growth and aim to implement psychoeducation into my therapeutic style and in my work with clients.

Amy works with both English and Spanish speaking clients.

Amy sees clients via telehealth only.
team_members.descriptionEs:
�Hola! Soy Amy Melendrez, trabajadora social con licencia en Nuevo M�xico y hablante nativa de espa�ol. Soy primera en mi familia en graduarme de la universidad y obtuve mi maestr�a y licenciatura en trabajo social en la Universidad Highlands de Nuevo M�xico. He trabajado sirviendo a la comunidad latina e inmigrante y tengo experiencia trabajando con adolescentes, adultos y familias. Creo que todas las personas tienen derecho a la educaci�n, la sanaci�n y el crecimiento, y mi objetivo es integrar la psicoeducaci�n en mi estilo terap�utico y en mi trabajo con clientes.

Amy trabaja con clientes que hablan ingl�s y espa�ol.

Amy atiende a sus clientes �nicamente mediante telesalud.

team_members.role: Chief Operating Officer Substance Use Counselor
team_members.descriptionEn:
Andrea Lucero (she/her) is a Licensed Alcohol and Drug Abuse Counselor (LADAC) and Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC) with over six years of experience working with clients both individually and in groups. Born and raised in Albuquerque, Andrea sought a new adventure by completing her Bachelor�s degree at Sarah Lawrence College in New York. Being 2,000 miles away from home helped her appreciate her Chicana roots and recognize the importance of cultural competency in therapy and its impact on client outcomes. During this transformative period, she also developed a profound respect for the LGBTQIA+ community.

As a counselor, Andrea is dedicated to creating a safe and supportive space where BIPOC and LGBTQIA+ clients can find the help they need to recover. She utilizes Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT), Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), and person-centered approaches in her practice. Andrea�s commitment to fostering an inclusive and understanding environment is at the core of her therapeutic approach.

Andrea was named WholeSelf Counseling�s Chief Operating Officer in May, 2025.

Currently, Andrea�s caseload is full and there is a wait list.

Ayanna has over 20 years of experience working in various social service settings that encompass a diverse population. Ayanna obtained a Bachelor of Arts degree in Sociology from California State University, Long Beach and a Master of Social Work degree from New Mexico Highlands University. Ayanna has a broad range of experience working with adolescents, at-risk youth and adults of all ages in order to help manage depression, anxiety, trauma, low self-esteem, stress, and life transitions. She uses techniques from Cognitive Behavioral Therapy, Solution-Focused Therapy and Motivational Interviewing while utilizing a person-centered, strengths-based framework to highlight her clients� natural abilities, values and beliefs. Ayanna creates a safe space to be able to �feel all the feels� and welcomes you to be your authentic self while working on your journey of healing.

Hi! I�m Charlycia,  

I am a Certified Peer Support Worker, (CPSW). You might be wondering�what exactly is a CPSW?

In this role, my primary focus is to provide emotional support, encouragement, and practical guidance. This can be done in individual sessions or group work. I help people navigate systems, build coping strategies, and make meaningful changes, all through the lens of my own lived experiences. 

I grew up in a tough environment and developed behaviors that once protected me but eventually held me back. With time, support, and access to resources, I was able to make healthier choices for both my mind and body. Now, I use that journey to walk alongside others facing their own challenges.

I have a passion for supporting people who face racism and discrimination, those in the LGBTQ+ community, and individuals navigating faith-related or cultural identity struggles. I understand how anxiety, trauma, and major life transitions can affect your sense of self�and I�m here to support you through it with a focus on both mental and physical wellness. 

I also hold a Bachelor�s degree in Social Work and am certified as a Comprehensive Community Support Services (CCSS) provider. If you feel like I might be a good fit for your journey, I�d be honored to walk with you.

Chavonne McClay (she/her) is a Black, queer, neurodivergent, fat woman who has been a Licensed Clinical Social Worker since 2013. She lives with her family in Albuquerque, NM, on occupied Tiwa territory. Please consider paying monthly rent for the tribal land that you occupy. 

Chavonne holds a bachelor�s degree in psychology and a master�s degree in social work. Chavonne is the founder and clinical director of WholeSelf Counseling, a social justice-informed therapy group practice that empowers people of color to radically improve relationships with themselves and the world around them in order to live with authenticity and joy. She is also the co-host of a podcast, �Embodiment for the Rest of Us�, which empowers listeners to radically improve their relationships with their bodies and food while dismantling weight stigma in all of the intersectional aspects of society. Throughout her career, all of Chavonne�s work has focused on the mental health of members of the global majority (aka BIPOC folks) as well as all folks focused on healing relationships with body, food, and self within a framework that centers and holds those living in marginalized spaces and bodies. When not working, Chavonne enjoys reading, long walks (on the beach when she�s lucky), crafting, doing Legos and puzzles, and reading and watching stodgy British mysteries.

Because it takes a lot of time and energy running her dream practice, Chavonne does not see clients. But you�ll see her around the office all of the time, so please feel free to say hello!

Clare (she/her) is a Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW) in the state of New Mexico. Originally from New York, she earned her Bachelor�s in Communication Studies before completing her Master�s in Social Work at Boston College in 2021. Clare works with clients to navigate stress, identity, and the pursuit of an authentic life. Clare�s approach is rooted in Internal Family Systems (IFS), psychoeducation, and a decolonized lens, providing a collaborative space to explore inner experiences, build resilience, and foster self-compassion.

She has a focused interest in supporting individuals at the intersection of complex PTSD and neurodivergence, helping them understand how their minds and bodies respond to the world while developing practical tools for coping and growth. Clare emphasizes curiosity, empowerment, and honoring all parts of the self, guiding clients toward living in alignment with their genuine selves.


Outside of her clinical work, she enjoys comedy, music, thrifting, and discovering interesting fidgets. She shares an office with her dog, Darbus, who provides a comforting environment through her snores.

Currently, Clare has a waitlist for new clients.

Meet Darbus, the Brussels Griffon with a heart of gold and a unique approach to counseling! Darbus specializes in relaxation therapy and has 10 years of experience perfecting the art of restorative rest. With her unparalleled ability to achieve deep states of relaxation, she models the importance of quality sleep in promoting emotional well-being. Darbus is dedicated to demonstrating the therapeutic benefits of unabashed slumber and unconditional positive (pawsitive) regard. When she is not serving her community, you can find Darbus laying on hot rocks outside.

If you�re seeking serenity through the gentle symphony of snores, Darbus is here to guide you to your goals!
team_members.descriptionEs:
�Conozcan a Darbus, la grif�n de Bruselas con un coraz�n de oro y un enfoque �nico para la terapia! Darbus se especializa en terapia de relajaci�n y cuenta con 10 a�os de experiencia perfeccionando el arte del descanso reparador. Con su incomparable habilidad para alcanzar estados de relajaci�n profunda, demuestra la importancia de un sue�o de calidad para el bienestar emocional. Darbus se dedica a mostrar los beneficios terap�uticos de una siesta sin complejos y de una atenci�n positiva incondicional (y con mucho cari�o). Cuando no est� ayudando a su comunidad, pueden encontrar a Darbus descansando sobre piedras calientes al aire libre.

Si buscan serenidad a trav�s de la dulce sinfon�a de los ronquidos, �Darbus est� aqu� para guiarlos hacia sus objetivos!

team_members.descriptionEn:
My name is Diana Hern�ndez and I am a Licensed Professional Counselor, bilingual in Spanish and English. I grew up in the United States and am the daughter of Mexican immigrants. This combination of cultures has given me a deep sensitivity toward different perspectives and a clear understanding of the importance of honoring cultural values both in the therapeutic process and in my own personal development.

I have over 12 years of experience in the mental health field and more than 6 years as a licensed psychotherapist. I have worked in community health services, providing support to vulnerable populations such as uninsured individuals, immigrants, refugees, Spanish-speaking families, domestic violence survivors, people with addiction issues, among others.

My specialties include treating depression, trauma, adolescence, family and couples therapy. Throughout my career, I have received training in suicide prevention and intervention, polyvagal theory interventions, and sandtray therapy for children. Additionally, I am a certified facilitator of the Circle of Security program and am currently in the process of obtaining official certification as an EMDR therapist.

As a therapist, my approach is based on compassion, authenticity, and self-reflection. I firmly believe that all people possess inner wisdom, but that it is necessary to cultivate self-compassion to access it. The internal work we do in therapy can be challenging, and even frustrating at times, but also deeply transformative.

My goal is to accompany you so that you can see yourself, your family, and your partner not as obstacles, but as fundamental allies on your path to healing.
team_members.descriptionEs:
Mi nombre es Diana Hern�ndez y soy una Consejera Cl�nica Profesional Licenciada, biling�e en espa�ol e ingl�s. Crec� en los Estados Unidos y soy hija de inmigrantes mexicanos. Esta combinaci�n de culturas me ha brindado una profunda sensibilidad hacia diferentes perspectivas y una comprensi�n clara de la importancia de honrar los valores culturales tanto en el proceso terap�utico como en mi propio desarrollo personal.

Cuento con m�s de 12 a�os de trayectoria en el campo de la salud mental y m�s de 6 a�os como psicoterapeuta con licencia. He trabajado en servicios comunitarios de salud, ofreciendo apoyo a poblaciones vulnerables como personas sin seguro m�dico, inmigrantes, refugiados, familias hispanohablantes, sobrevivientes de violencia dom�stica, personas con problemas de adicci�n, entre otros.

Mis especialidades incluyen el tratamiento de la depresi�n, el trauma, la adolescencia, la terapia familiar y de pareja. A lo largo de mi carrera, he recibido formaci�n en prevenci�n e intervenci�n en suicidio, en intervenciones desde la teor�a polivagal, y en terapia con bandeja de arena (Sandtray) para ni�os. Adem�s, soy facilitadora certificada del programa C�rculo de Seguridad y actualmente me encuentro en proceso de obtener la certificaci�n oficial como terapeuta EMDR.

Como terapeuta, mi enfoque se basa en la compasi�n, la autenticidad y la autorreflexi�n. Creo firmemente que todas las personas poseen una sabidur�a interior, pero que es necesario cultivar la autocompasi�n para acceder a ella. El trabajo interno que realizamos en terapia puede ser desafiante, e incluso frustrante en ocasiones, pero tambi�n profundamente transformador.

Mi objetivo es acompa�arte para que puedas verte a ti mismo/a, a tu familia y a tu pareja no como obst�culos, sino como aliados fundamentales en tu camino hacia la sanaci�n.

team_members.descriptionEn:
Dolores Scarlett Cortez is an educator and multidisciplinary artist raised in Tulsa, Oklahoma. She moved to New Mexico in 2015 to study Studio Art at the Institute of American Indian Arts. While in undergrad, Scarlett utilized art to combat the cultural suppression of her Latina identity, which she had experienced while in Oklahoma. Since then, Scarlett has been working with her peers in New Mexico to heal generational wounds and cultivate a culture of healing.

Scarlett has four and a half years of case management experience working with marginalized youth experiencing homelessness. When working with others, Scarlett likes to utilize person-centered approaches such as trauma-informed care,  the Nurtured Heart Approach, and harm reduction tools to help others be their best and most authentic selves. She is a current graduate student pursuing a master�s degree in art therapy / counseling at Southwestern College in Santa Fe, NM. 

As a future therapist, Scarlett hopes to work with Spanish-speaking and diverse populations using alternative forms of therapy such as art therapy and poetry therapy to address issues around depression, anxiety, suicidal ideation, addiction, and nonsuicidal self-injury.

 In her time off, Scarlett likes to write poetry, pet sit, and explore new food places with her partner.
team_members.descriptionEs:
Dolores Scarlett Cortez es una educadora y artista multidisciplinaria criada en Tulsa, Oklahoma. Se mud� a Nuevo M�xico en 2015 para estudiar Arte en el Institute of American Indian Arts. Durante este tiempo, Scarlett utiliz� el arte para combatir la represi�n cultural de su identidad latina, que hab�a experimentado mientras estaba en Oklahoma. Desde entonces, Scarlett ha estado trabajando con sus compa�eros en Nuevo M�xico para superar heridas generacionales y cultivar una cultura de bienestar.

Scarlett tiene cuatro a�os y medio de experiencia en coordinaci�n de servicios trabajando con j�venes sin hogar.  Al trabajar con otros, a Scarlett le gusta utilizar enfoques centrados en la persona, como el cuidado informado sobre el trauma, el Coraz�n Nutrido y herramientas de reducci�n de da�os para ayudar a los dem�s. Actualmente es estudiante de posgrado en el programa de maestr�a en terapia art�stica / consejer�a en Southwestern College en Santa Fe, NM.

Como futura terapeuta, a Scarlett le gustar�a trabajar con poblaciones hispanohablantes y diversas utilizando formas alternativas de terapia, como la terapia art�stica y la terapia con poes�a, para abordar problemas relacionados con la depresi�n, la ansiedad, la ideaci�n suicida, la adicci�n y la autolesi�n no suicida.

En su tiempo libre, a Scarlett le gusta escribir poes�a, cuidar mascotas y explorar nuevos lugares de comida con su pareja.

team_members.descriptionEn:
Dulce is a dedicated native Spanish speaker who has committed her career to serving Limited English Proficient and Immigrant Communities. For the past 13 years, she has excelled as an Interpreter, Translator, and Promotora for Latino community members. With dual Master�s degrees in Social Work and Business Administration, Dulce has significantly contributed to several research projects. As a therapist, she specializes in working with victims of crime, focusing on addressing anxiety, trauma, depression, and grief. Dulce is passionate about making health resources accessible, raising awareness, and breaking down the stigma surrounding mental health issues in the immigrant community.

Dulce is honored to work only with Spanish-speaking clients.
team_members.descriptionEs:
Dulce es una hispanohablante nativa dedicada que ha comprometido su carrera al servicio de las comunidades de inmigrantes y con dominio limitado del ingl�s. Durante los �ltimos 13 a�os, se ha destacado como int�rprete, traductora y promotora para los miembros de la comunidad latina. Con doble maestr�a en Trabajo Social y Administraci�n de Empresas, Dulce ha contribuido significativamente a varios proyectos de investigaci�n. Como terapeuta, est� especializada en el trabajo con v�ctimas de delitos, centr�ndose en el tratamiento de la ansiedad, el trauma, la depresi�n y el duelo. A Dulce le apasiona hacer accesibles los recursos sanitarios, concienciar y acabar con el estigma que rodea a los problemas de salud mental en la comunidad inmigrante.

Dulce tiene el honor de trabajar �nicamente con clientes de habla hispana.

team_members.descriptionEn:
Esperanza Flores (she/her/hers) (POC/Chicana) earned her BA in Psychology and Sociology from UNM in 2018. She earned her Master of Social Work from Western New Mexico University in 2022.

She has experience working with children and adults, the LGBTQ+ community, families/individuals that have been impacted by child welfare and the legal system, survivors of DV and trafficking, those who live with disabilities, those who struggle with symptoms of anxiety, depression, trauma, addiction, schizophrenia, and other stigmatized diagnoses.

Esperanza feels deeply connected to issues surrounding intergenerational trauma, grief processing, oppression, and impacts from the carceral and �larger� systems in society. Her approach is grounded in empathy, active listening, a collaborative mindset, and of course recognizing the strengths that each holds within themselves. The practices she integrates into working with others include cultural humility, motivational interviewing, TF-CBT, narrative and storytelling, bibliotherapy, duality, value identification, and non-western traditional healing such as creative expressions. All with a whole person, client-centered approach woven in with strong threads.

Esperanza is dedicated to creating an environment where others feel heard, understood, empowered, and supported in working towards their own path to healing and discovery to promote and improve their quality of life.

Aside from work, she enjoys continuously learning about new things from new recipes to learning about evolving identities and the in-between topics! She enjoys expressive writing, sipping a cozy cup of coffee, outdoor adventures, and spending time with her loved ones.

She has and continues to learn the most by talking with, working alongside, and serving others. She believes that every individual and family are experts of themselves, their world, and their experiences. You are welcome here, please come as you are.

�Awakening is not changing who you are but discarding who you are not.� Deepak Chopra

Esperanza visits with clients in person and via telehealth!

Hi, my name is Itzel Gutierrez. I am a native Spanish speaker who came to the United States in 2003 with my mother. As an immigrant myself, I deeply understand the emotional, social, and cultural challenges that individuals and families face when moving to a new country. I know how important it is to adapt to a new environment while still preserving our culture, language, and roots.

I earned my Master�s in Social Work in May 2023 because I recognized the great need for culturally humble mental health professionals in our community. Throughout my journey, I have had the privilege of working with immigrant families from diverse backgrounds. These experiences have strengthened my belief in the importance of accessible, compassionate, and culturally responsive care.

My professional experience includes working with children and adults who are coping with anxiety, depression, grief, trauma, and life transitions. I also have experience supporting children, particularly those with ADHD and Autism. I believe in meeting people where they are, and I tailor my approach to each individual�s strengths and needs.

My priority is always to create a safe, welcoming environment where people feel heard, respected, and empowered. I strive to build genuine and trusting connections with my clients so they can begin or continue their healing journey with confidence and support.
team_members.descriptionEs:
Hola, mi nombre es Itzel Guti�rrez. Soy hispanohablante nativa y llegu� a los Estados Unidos en el 2003 con mi mam�. Como inmigrante, entiendo profundamente los desaf�os emocionales, sociales y culturales que enfrentan las personas y las familias al mudarse a un nuevo pa�s. S� lo importante que es adaptarse a un nuevo entorno sin perder nuestra cultura, idioma y ra�ces.


Obtuve mi Maestr�a en Trabajo Social en mayo del 2023 porque reconoc� la gran necesidad de profesionales de salud mental culturalmente humildes en nuestra comunidad. A lo largo de mi trayectoria, he tenido el privilegio de trabajar con familias inmigrantes de diversos or�genes. Estas experiencias han fortalecido mi compromiso de ofrecer atenci�n compasiva y accesible que honre la cultura y la identidad de cada persona.

Mi experiencia profesional incluye el trabajo con ni�os y adultos que enfrentan ansiedad, depresi�n, duelo, trauma y transiciones importantes en la vida. Tambi�n tengo experiencia apoyando a ni�os, especialmente aquellos con TDAH y Autismo. Creo firmemente en acompa�ar a las personas desde donde se encuentran y adaptar mi enfoque a las fortalezas y necesidades individuales.

Mi prioridad siempre es crear un ambiente seguro y acogedor donde las personas se sientan escuchadas, respetadas y empoderadas. Me esfuerzo por construir conexiones genuinas y de confianza con mis clientes para que puedan comenzar o continuar su camino de sanaci�n con apoyo y confianza.

team_members.descriptionEn:
Jade S�nchez (she/ella), is a Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), a Licensed Alcohol and Drug Abuse Counselor (LADAC) and Certified Peer Support Worker (CPSW) in the state of New Mexico where she has worked in the behavioral health field since 2014. She graduated with a dual major in Spanish and Psychology from the University of New Mexico, and a Masters in Social Work from Western New Mexico University. Jade is a bilingual, bicultural and binational woman of color. Jade�s roots has allowed her to connect with her Latine monolingual Spanish community.

She is an advocate for social justice which includes, reproductive and transformative justice, culture shift, and families impacted and/or separated by systems (CPS and immigration systems, among others).

Jade enjoys working through a strength-based, trauma-informed, abolitionist lens, using Mindfulness, EMDR and somatic awareness skills to support clients in working through trauma and substance use. She finds purpose and connection when working with women, families, adolescents, the recovering population, queer, LGBTQ+, and any communities of color. She finds joy being outside, practicing traditional healing methods, spending time with her partner Fernando, and children. Her favorite things to do are get treats from the Michoacana and watch TikTok. 

Jade sees clients via telehealth only.

Currently, Jade�s caseload is full and there is a wait list.
team_members.descriptionEs:
Jade S�nchez (she/ella), tiene licencia clinica autorizada en trabajo social cl�nica (LCSW), licencia de consejer�a en Alcohol y Abuso de las drogas consejera (LADAC) y certificaci�n en trabajo de apoyo (CPSW) en el estado de Nuevo M�xico donde ella ha estado trabajando en el campo de la salud mental desde 2014. Es graduada en dos especialidades en la Universidad de Nuevo M�xico (psicologia y espa�ol) y una maestr�a en trabajo social de Universidad de Western Nuevo M�xico. Jade es biling�e, bicultural, binacional mujer de color. Sus ra�ces est�n conectadas con la comunidad latina, que hablan solo espa�ol. 

Ella es defensora de la justicia social que incluye derechos reproductivos y justicia transformativa, y familias impactadas de los sistemas (CPS e inmigraci�n)

Jade disfruta trabajar con base en la fuerza, informada sobre el trauma, con una perspectiva abolicionista, usando las tecnicas Mindfulness, EMDR y habilidades som�ticas para apoyar a clientes que atraviesan trauma y uso de sustancias. Ella encontr� prop�sito y conexi�n cuando trabaja con mujeres, familias, adolescentes, personas en recuperaci�n, LGBTQ+, y personas de cualquier comunidad de color. 

Disfruta estar en la naturaleza, practicar m�todos tradicionales de salud, pasar tiempo con su esposo, hijos, y familia. Su favorito pasatiempo es visitar la paleter�a michoacana y mirar TikTok.

Jade ve a los clientes solo a trav�s de telesalud.

Actualmente, Jade tiene una lista de espera.

team_members.role: Mental Health Therapist Art Therapy Specialization
team_members.descriptionEn:
Hello! I�m Jane, a licensed mental health counselor; trained in art therapy. Originally from Oregon, I came to New Mexico to study art therapy and counseling and fell in love with the Southwest. My approach to therapy integrates Art Therapy, Internal Family Systems, Mindfulness and Interpersonal Neurobiology. I am passionate about helping people understand their inner worlds as well as the systems that impact their lives. I am committed to being trauma-informed and culturally aware to provide people who identity as BIPOC, LGBTQ+, and neurodiverse the mental health services they need to thrive.

I am a fierce ally and passionate about creating safe spaces for LGBTQ+ adolescents to explore their identities. I believe it is essential or provide the education and resources youth need to feel connected to themselves and the world around them.

Outside of work, I love to spend time outside with my family and friends. I am a ceramic artist and passionate about using creativity to create connection.

 

Jane sees clients via telehealth only.

team_members.role: Internship Program Supervisor Mental Health Therapist
team_members.descriptionEn:
Katherine Catanach (she/her) is a Licensed Associate Marriage and Family Therapist who currently resides on Tiwa land. Katherine provides relational and individual therapy utilizing Internal Family Systems, Narrative Therapy, Solution-Focused Therapy, and Dialectical Behavioral Therapy modalities to support clients. She specializes in life transitions, anxiety, sexual issues, and identity exploration. 

 

Katherine identifies as Queer and is a member of the Zuni Pueblo. She is passionate about providing therapy to folks who identify as BIPOC, LGBTQ+ and/or polyamorous or non-monogamous. Katherine strives to work from a trauma informed, systems based, queer-feminist perspective. Katherine�s goal is to ensure everyone feels seen and heard on their journey to healing and fulfillment.

 

In her free time, she enjoys gardening, drawing, cooking, crafting, and caring for her two elderly chihuahuas.



Katherine sees clients in person only.

 

Currently, Katherine has a waitlist for new clients.

If you had to describe your life lately in one word, maybe it�s overwhelmed.

Big life transitions�starting a new career, navigating relationships, family conflict, grief, or even the constant stream of news�can stir up a complex mix of emotions. You may find yourself feeling disconnected from loved ones, questioning your decisions, or lying awake at night wondering when things will feel manageable again.

If any of this resonates, you�re not alone�and you don�t have to move through it alone.

I�m a Licensed Clinical Social Worker with 8 years of experience helping individuals manage anxiety, reduce stress, and reconnect with a sense of purpose and self-trust. In our work together, I�ll support you in identifying and reducing anxiety triggers, building practical coping strategies, and exploring self-esteem and identity in ways that honor your lived experience. We�ll focus on helping you feel more grounded and empowered to move forward with clarity and confidence.

I draw from Solution-Focused Therapy, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT) Skills, and Mindfulness Techniques. My practice is informed by Systems Theory and rooted in values of collective care, healing, and social justice.


I work with BIPOC adults (18+), supporting them through life transitions, anxiety, and identity exploration in a space where their experiences are truly seen and respected.

Luis Alvarado (he / him) is a Master of Social Work graduate whose journey into the field is rooted in a lifelong dedication to service, empathy, and the belief in every individual�s inherent worth. Luis received his Masters in Social Work from the University of Southern California in 2020. His background spans both the service and corporate sectors, where he cultivated strong relational and communication skills while engaging with people from a wide range of cultural, racial, and socioeconomic backgrounds.

Luis brings a calm and grounded presence to his work with the belief in meeting individuals where they are. He is particularly drawn to supporting individuals seeking purpose and meaning in their lives�those reflecting on their lived experiences and striving to create alignment between what they think, say, and do. His therapeutic style invites reflection, discovery, and recognizing that healing often begins with reclaiming one�s narrative.

Luis practices from an eclectic therapy approach, integrating person-centered, solution-focused, and problem-solving modalities. He believes in co-creating a safe and collaborative space that empowers an individual to define their own goals and path forward. He is committed to practicing authenticity, patience, and cultural responsiveness toward individuals as they explore pathways to wholeness, stability, and harmony.

Luis enjoys spending time with his tripod bull/boxer Gus. Luis and Gus practice mindfulness by basking under the sun with squinted eyes and heads held up toward the breeze.

Mikaylah Campbell, BA, NMHU Student, is our new intern therapist. She is working toward becoming a licensed clinical social worker and enjoys working with and learning from others. She is passionate about Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT), and loves to hear others express their passions in life. Her bubbly personality and caring attitude allows her to connect with people on a meaningful level. She enjoys true crime, sweet foods, and everything pink! 

Mikaylah is extremely passionate about supporting individuals through trauma responses and works from a trauma-informed lens. She works from an Afrocentric and feminist model and aims to decolonize the typical western �therapy models�. With that being said, Mikaylah does work with dialectical behavioral (DBT) and cognitive behavioral (CBT) tools. Traditional forms of therapy pique her interest and she believes in generational trauma being healed through traditional practices; she always supports clients in connecting with their ancestral roots and encourages self-exploration.

Beginning in May of 2025, Mikaylah will be taking on new clients as a clinical intern with Whole Self and is excited to meet people and hear about their human experience. She aims to use her education and love for humanity to aid others in this journey called life.

I am a bilingual licensed social worker with a deep commitment to supporting individuals and families through their healing journeys. Since 2018, I have worked in the mental health field, providing care across diverse settings and age groups�including children, teens, adults, and families.

For the past four years, I have served as a medical social worker, where I supported patients navigating complex health and emotional challenges. I am also a nationally certified medical interpreter, and I offer therapy services fluently in both English and Spanish. My work with bilingual and multicultural families has shaped my approach to be culturally responsive, compassionate, and collaborative.

In my new role as a therapist, I look forward to building meaningful connections and creating a safe, supportive space where clients feel heard, valued, and empowered to grow.

 

Paola meets with participants virtually.
team_members.descriptionEs:
Soy una trabajadora social biling�e con licencia y un profundo compromiso con el apoyo a personas y familias en su proceso de sanaci�n. Desde 2018, he trabajado en el campo de la salud mental, brindando atenci�n en diversos entornos y grupos de edad, incluyendo ni�os, adolescentes, adultos y familias.

Durante los �ltimos cuatro a�os, me he desempe�ado como trabajadora social m�dica, donde he apoyado a pacientes que enfrentan desaf�os complejos de salud y emocionales. Tambi�n soy int�rprete m�dica certificada a nivel nacional y ofrezco servicios de terapia con fluidez en ingl�s y espa�ol. Mi trabajo con familias biling�es y multiculturales ha moldeado mi enfoque para ser culturalmente receptiva, compasiva y colaborativa.


En mi nuevo rol como terapeuta, espero construir conexiones significativas y crear un espacio seguro y de apoyo donde los clientes se sientan escuchados, valorados y empoderados para crecer.

Paola se re�ne con las participantes virtualmente.

team_members.descriptionEn:
Sean Cardinalli (he/him) is a Master of Social Work candidate and a certified coach who specializes in working with individuals and their partners confounded by sex and love addiction. More broadly, he supports any client invested in seeking a healthier sense of intimacy and relationship. His approach is inspired by his own experience in talk therapy, somatic work, and 12-Step recovery. Sean regularly hosts groups on singlehood, divorce, dating, and personal boundaries. His counseling approach involves CBT, relational, and narrative methods, and is never shame-based; clients can�t learn to love themselves or others more healthily via negative reinforcement.

Sean works with a variety of clients regardless of gender identity, partner preference, or sexual proclivity. He and his clients explore the foundations of intimacy, honesty, and trust, and work diligently to restore a holistic sense of self while addressing past pain, present-day challenges, and future aspirations.

He earned his ICF-qualifying certificate via Wisdom of the Whole Coaching Academy, has a BA in English lit from UC Berkeley, and is the proud father of two young adults and a feisty Min Pin named Stella Luna.

Welcome! I am Sonia Ramirez, a licensed social worker in the state of New Mexico and a native Spanish speaker. My family, like many others, immigrated to Albuquerque from Mexico in 2002. Since then I have grown close to New Mexican culture and have experienced working with diverse families, including supporting  immigrant families who are navigating challenging family dynamics that often accompanies immigrating. I am passionate of the use of play therapy concepts as supports to empower children to process their experiences. 

My extensive experience working with children is specific to address anxiety, trauma, depression, grief, suicide ideation, adjustment difficulties, as well as complex family dynamics. I aim to address these symptoms through a collaboration with caregivers and children to provide a greater understanding of symptoms and proactive ways to address the root cause of symptoms. 

My  goal as a therapist is to provide a safe environment for children and caregivers to learn and grow.

Currently, Sonia has a waitlist for new clients.

Mi objetivo como terapeuta es proporcionar un entorno seguro para que los ni�os y los cuidadores aprendan y crezcan.
